page.title: 15RECREATION
page.content: Brands Hatch Racing Circuit-the second longest in Great Britain is just out- side our grid for Fawkham but close to it & in the grid are several appendages A hut is used by the British Racing & Sports Car Club,there are buildings to do with running the circuit,car parks, camping sites for large Grand Prix meetings & a small private air strip where light aircraft & helicopters land Employment for Fawkham residents is likely & the pub no doubt benefits from race meetings. The rear exit leads to the A20 or M20 or onto minor roads through the villages.After a race meeting all roads are heavily congested with home going traffic mostly heading for London. Grand Prix are held twice a year with famous drivers taking part.
